response.content: Alphabet Inc. (GOOGL) has been out-performing the stock market despite AI-related risks, with a market cap of $1.52 trillion and strong fundamentals. The company has positioned itself for success by hiring a former Apple executive and partnering with rival companies. In addition, Alphabet's enterprise to Ebitda ratio is 16.193, its debt to equity ratio is 11.305, its current ratio is 2.353, and its profit margin is 20.58%. Furthermore, the company is experiencing 2.6% revenue growth and has various products and platforms located across the United States, Europe, the Middle East, Africa, the Asia-Pacific, Canada, and Latin America. With its strategic initiatives, strong fundamentals, and immense opportunities in the years ahead, Alphabet Inc. is a stock worth considering for long-term investments.

Tesla (NASDAQ: TSLA) stock has been surging this year, bolstered by record second quarter deliveries of 466,140 EV ( electric vehicles) and stronger-than-expected fundamentals. Positive news reports about Tesla's impressive performance, market share, and possible net worth of up to a trillion dollars by 2025 have added fuel to the bullish sentiment in its stock, along with the bold 500% stock price prediction by Cathie Wood. The macro backdrop also looks favorable, with the Nasdaq Composite rallying 31.7% in the first half of the year - its biggest first-half increase in four decades. With its stock already up over 100% this year, many continue to be bullish on Tesla's outlook, and the company looks set to end the year on a high.

Apple Inc. made history this week as its market cap reached a record high of nearly $3 trillion. Apple's share price has soared 49% year-to-date, driven by strong second quarter deliveries from Tesla and upbeat economic optimism. The tech giant also has a robust cash position and continues to attract bullish investors. However, the complexity of the design for the Vision Pro headset had to be downsized due to difficulties in production, causing the release to be pushed back to early next year. Despite this, the company remains an attractive stock for investors with its innovative technology, experienced executive team, and growing market share. As Apple generates strong cash flows which can be reinvested strategically, the stock momentum is likely to continue, showing no signs of slowing down.

Amazon.com, Inc. (AMZN) saw its stock price reach new highs this week as analysts analyzed the latest data and news coming out of the company. The company has a market capitalization of $1.33 trillion and an enterprise to Ebitda ratio of 25.145. This indicates that Amazon's fundamentals remain strong despite the economic recovery.

Analysts noted that Amazon has successfully diversified its services over the years, quickly adapting to technological advances in AI and cloud computing. The company’s recent acquisition of the rights to broadcast the Super Bowl in 2023 and its investments in AI show its commitment to innovate and expand into new markets. Furthermore, its strong first quarter earnings, guidance, and improved outlook have all buoyed investor sentiment.

The market is bullish on Amazon’s future potential, hence analysts are recommending the stock as attractive for long-term investors. Investors should also keep an eye on the company’s second quarter earnings and outlook for a better view of the market’s sentiment when deciding to invest in the stock.
